[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19601?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19601?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [cdfce2b...0b81d3d](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19601?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
It's not clear exactly what this is fixing - your second example runs before this change?  Also needs tests, thanks.

As the tests are showing, this is more complicated than just removing the check - down in the c parser the line terminator can only be 1 character:
https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/df38f66b417b754afdd2b0e17282255bbf2c769e/pandas/_libs/src/parser/tokenizer.h#L172

`'\r\n'` is special - parsing code gets tough to follow, but is effectively the default.
https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/df38f66b417b754afdd2b0e17282255bbf2c769e/pandas/_libs/src/parser/tokenizer.c#L668

So a better workaround for #3501 may be to simply special-case it - treat `'\r\n'` as `lineterminator=None`
closing as stale. if you are interested in fixing according to @chris-b1 comments, pls ping / submit new pr.
